content.body: Mattias Buelens Domenic: could you spend a minute reading https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/10855#issuecomment-2647710959 and subsequent comments and see if you agree with the general idea? It sounds reasonable, but I want to make sure we tackle it in a similar way we did with streams.

content.body: Tomorrow's a holiday but will try to get to it in ~36 hours
zcorpan: if it's a quirk, wouldn't it be better to not apply it to menu/dir?
content.formatted_body: zcorpan: if it's a quirk, wouldn't it be better to not apply it to menu/dir?

content.body: annevk: it's the undoing of the quirk that should apply also to menu and dir
content.formatted_body: annevk: it's the undoing of the quirk that should apply also to menu and dir

content.body: i.e. if we want `<menu><li>` to have not-quirky rendering, `menu` needs to be included in the undoing style rule
content.formatted_body: i.e. if we want <menu><li> to have not-quirky rendering, menu needs to be included in the undoing style rule

content.body: I see, yeah I guess that makes sense
